info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berks, west central Montgomery and northeastern Chester Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elverson, or 11 miles southeast of Reading, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West Chester, Phoenixville, Downingtown, Birdsboro, Royersford, Honey Brook, Elverson, New Morgan, Pughtown, Lionville-Marchwood, Valley Forge, Glenmoore, Chester Springs, Lionville, Cedarville, Paoli, West Goshen, Stowe, Spring City and Malvern. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 322. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
